data.title: What a jem!
data.text: A coworker and myself were in town on business and were told to try Bay Street seafood and I am so glad we did. It doesn't have a lot of seating but it added to the relaxing atmosphere. The staff was so nice and treat you like family and the seafood was so fresh! Everything we ate was perfectly seasoned. I had the fish of the day sandwich blackened (perfectly cooked) and she had fried shrimp with some of the best onion rings I've ever had. We will definitely be coming back when we are in town!  Thanks for the hospitality!

data.title: Business trip
data.text: This place is awesome!! It's a small hole in the wall, if you blink you'll miss it!! Took my wife and 6month old daughter there...Almost no parking... it's old but clean and has character .. A+ service and food!! Worth the stop!!

data.title: Good food nice family
data.text: I love the grilled fish rueben here, and i don't really like fish or rye bread.  But this sandwich keeps me coming back.  Everyone I have told to try it ends up addicted to it also.  Everything here is really good and the family that runs it are really nice.

data.title: A great place for local fish
data.text: Great fish and onion rings. Go hungry, we had the Fish and chips with onion rings as an appetizer and we took half of our food home with us. This is hard to find but worth it. Many locals come and do take out.

data.title: Great seafood, great value!
data.text: If you want a place to just get some really good basic fried fish and chips, this is your place.   It is nothing fancy, but the food!  I usually like breaded fish, but I tried my friend's fried battered fish, and it was AMAZING!  It was not the thick, yellow batter you get other places; it was very thin, had fantastic flavor, and did not separate from the fish while you were eating it.  The onion rings are the thickness of onion straws, and you get a huge basket; it was hard to stop eating them.  Spiced shrimp was totally worth the effort to peel them!   I will be back!

data.title: "Embarrassed to have taken visiting family there!"
data.text: If you like fish sandwiches for dinner, then maybe this is the place for you.  Who rated this place #3???  This was a hole where the kitchen, cash register, and a few table were placed in one room!  However, I've been to places like this, but the food always made up for the decor and they have "atmosphere"!  Now the food...fish was tasty but served with a few onion rings and a tiny cup of cucumber salad...For $20, I left hungry and thoroughly disappointed.  My guests were even more disappointed in their food!  I am a local and since my guests wanted someplace near their hotel, I relied on TripAdvisor's rating and due to the fact that the restaurant didn't list their prices on the menu, I took a chance.  I will never go back!!!

data.title: Hole in the wall, that was nothing amazing!
data.text:
Went in for the shrimp salad which we have heard friends rave about...when we asked about it, we were told it was too much to keep up with with so many people ordering it! Really, if you have something awesome on your menu that people raving about and ordering why would you get rid of it?'

Crab salad sandwich was canned crab meat- meh at best!

Fried green tomatoes thinly sliced which makes them greasy, served with ranch dressing from a bottle. 

The clam chowder very watery and lacking flavor. 

Would not go back here.

data.title: Yum!
data.text:
Great food & service!  Had the catch of the day fish sandwich with onion rings and both were excellent!

Will be back and recommending to friends!

data.title: Lunch trip for fried oysters
data.text: We have recently taken to fried oysters, we just learned of this restaurant and the fact they have fried oysters.  Its nothing fancy, in fact you could totally drive by it and not even know you missed it.  The owner and workers were quite friendly and helpful.  Seems like they do a large take out business but you can also eat inside, plastic forks and knives.  We both had the aforementioned oysters, you may get 8 or 12 priced accordingly, you have your choice of two sides with your meal..we enjoyed our meal very tasty.  There are other seafood items on the menu, and it appears they have daily specials...we will be back

data.title: Seafood lunch
data.text:
Wanted to try this place while in Daytona because I'm always looking for good seafood places. First attempt was on Sunday, but it was closed. It's also very easy to miss, even with GPS. It's attached to a furniture store, but it's so small, drove by it twice. The location is easy to find, it's just the restaurant itself. We came back the next day for lunch and it was great. Had the shrimp/onionring basket, which was very good. The price is great; a very good value.
The perfect place when you are craving fried seafood and the service was quick and easy. It's no frills, but nice and clean. Will stop again when in the area and mention it to anyone traveling to Daytona.

data.title: Wonderful!
data.text: Best spot for lunch!! We always eat here for lunch when in Daytona Beach! You cannot go wrong with the fish sandwich of the day, fish Reuben and crab dip!

data.title: Delicious and plentiful Fried Shrimp
data.text: I had the 12 shrimp with cole slaw and onion rings.  The shrimp were quite large and the onion rings filled out the remainder of the plate.  All of it was delicious!  I highly recommend this restaurant.

data.title: Great food!
data.text: Get past the super simplicity of the restaurant because the food here is wonderful. We ordered 1 order of onion rings, there must have been at least 3 onions cut, battered, fried and then put on our table. There's this wonderful flavor of something added to the batter which gave the onion rings a very different flavor. YUM. Then we both had the fried platter. We should have just gotten one platter to share, the amount of food we were served was unreal. We will come back here the next time we are in Daytona.

data.title: Great Food 'n' Colorful Characters
data.text: Blackened grouper!!! Over the top and off the charts! Classic "dive w amazing local fare." Enjoyed talking w staff while eating the freshest seafood around. Proves that any 4.5 or higher rating on TripAdvisor is WORTH IT!

data.title: Best Kept Secret
data.text: When I'm at the beach, I want seafood.  And at least a couple of times, I want FRIED seafood...in a basket, with lots of ketchup.  Bay Street Seafood is one of Daytona Beach's best kept secrets.  I've been going to the Ormond/Daytona Beach area for years and just found it (thanks to a pal) this year.  Hole in the wall on a side street in downtown Daytona Beach...BEST onion rings you will ever hope to have.  Great fish, great shrimp, great service.  GO!

data.title: Fabulous food
data.text: We picked this place to try because of Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. Food was amazing. Family owned and was a very quaint place with fun touches. We will definitely try this place again.

data.title: Great fish on a side street in Daytona Beach, worth the trip
data.text: Bay Street Seafood is a diamond in the rough for those who want good fresh seafood expertly prepared and served in large portions. This is made possible by sticking to basics and forgoing all of the resort tackiness found at most Daytona area fish houses. We had two pieces of broiled haddock per serving along with sides pleasantly different from the usual fries and hush puppies. The kitchen is semi open so, depending where you sit, one can see everything being prepared. Go early as they close at 7:30PM.

data.title: Quaint Quality
data.text:
Family owned and it shows .. Small restaurant with big taste and value..

Not fancy..that's the charm

Fresh and fantastic sums this place up

data.title: great food
data.text: small place but excellent food fried platter is excellent, wife loves their halibutgood friendly service

data.title: Great seafood
data.text: Biggest order of onion rings I've ever ordered on the appitizer menu. Gator bites fantastic. I ordered blackened swordfish sandwich and dad ordered grilled Mahi sandwich. Both were fantastic. Added some of the onion rings to the sandwiches and even better. Nice little place for a fantastic lunch.
